SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

eu.advance.logistics.flow.engine.util
Class KeystoreManager

java.lang.Object
  eu.advance.logistics.flow.engine.util.KeystoreManager

public class KeystoreManager
extends java.lang.Object

Manges keystore specific operations. Allows to create, save and load a keystore. Can generate new private key and certificate. Creates certificate signing requests and allows the import of the reply from the CA. Uses the Bouncy Castle JCE provider and 1024 bit RSA keys Example:

KeystoreManager km = new KeystoreManager();
km.create();
String dn = "CN=David Karnok, OU=EMI, O=MTA SZTAKI";
km.generateRSACert("test", dn, dn, "localhost", "abc".toCharArray());
System.out.println(km.getCertificate("test"));
System.out.println(km.getPrivateKey("test", "abc".toCharArray()));
System.out.println(km.createRSASigningRequest("test", "abc".toCharArray()));

Original idea: http://www.koders.com/java/fid165B893DAEA5F8D4AD44CCF9B8FBE75B01CE6575.aspx

Author:
akarnokd, 2007.12.06.

Constructor Detail

public KeystoreManager()
Constructor. Creates an empty keystore in memory.

Method Detail

create

public void create()
Create a new JKS keystore. Throws KeystoreFault if the operation fails

load

public void load(java.lang.String fileName,
                 char[] password)
Load a keystore from the given file. Throws KeystoreFault if something failed.

Parameters:
fileName - the filename
password - the keystore password if supplied

load

public void load(java.io.InputStream in,
                 char[] password)
Load a keystore from the given input stream. Does not close the input stream. Throws KeystoreFault if something failed.

Parameters:
in - the input stream, should not be null
password - the keystore password if supplied

Parameters:
fileName - the filename
password - the password if supplied

                 char[] password)
Save the current keystore into the given output stream. Does not close the stream

out - the output stream
password - the password if supplied

generateKeyPair

public java.security.KeyPair generateKeyPair(java.lang.String algorithm,
                                             int size)
Generate a public/private keypair using the given algorithm and size.

Parameters:
algorithm - the algorithm (DSA/RSA)
size - the key size, usually 1024
Returns:
the generated keypair.

createX509Certificate

public java.security.cert.X509Certificate createX509Certificate(java.security.KeyPair keypair,
                                                                int months,
                                                                java.lang.String issuerDN,
                                                                java.lang.String subjectDN,
                                                                java.lang.String domain,
                                                                java.lang.String signAlgorithm)
Generate a X509 certificate for the given keypair. The distinguished names must be in format: CN=cName, OU=orgUnit, O=org, L=city, S=state, C=countryCode use backslash to escape a comma

Parameters:
keypair - the keypair
months - the validity length in months
issuerDN - the issuer distinguished name: "CN=David Karnok,OU=EMI,O=MTA SZTAKI"
subjectDN - the subject distinguished name: "CN=David Karnok,OU=EMI,O=MTA SZTAKI"
domain - domain of the server to store in the subject alternative name extension
signAlgorithm - the signing algorithm to use
Returns:
the generated X509 certificate

generateRSACert

public java.security.cert.X509Certificate generateRSACert(java.lang.String alias,
                                                          java.lang.String issuerDN,
                                                          java.lang.String subjectDN,
                                                          java.lang.String domain,
                                                          char[] password)
Generate an RSA 1024 bit key and certificate and add it to the current keystore under the given alias. The distinguished names must be in format: CN=cName, OU=orgUnit, O=org, L=city, S=state, C=countryCode use backslash to escape a comma

Parameters:
alias - the certificate alias
issuerDN - the issuer distinguished name: "CN=David Karnok,OU=EMI,O=MTA SZTAKI"
subjectDN - the subject distinguished name: "CN=David Karnok,OU=EMI,O=MTA SZTAKI"
domain - domain of the server to store in the subject alternative name extension
password - the key password
Returns:
the generated X509Certificate

createRSASigningRequest

public java.lang.String createRSASigningRequest(java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert,
                                                java.security.PrivateKey privKey)
Create a certificate signing request. The created text can be sent to a Certificate Authority to request a countersigning.

Parameters:
cert - the local X509Certificate object
privKey - the private key of the certificate
Returns:
the request string

Generate an RSA signing request for the given key alias.

Parameters:
alias - the alias
password - the private key password
Returns:
the signing request text

                         char[] password,
                         java.io.InputStream caReply,
                         boolean verifyRoot)
Installs the signing request response to an existing certificate in the keystore.

Parameters:
alias - the alias of the original certificate
password - the password of the certificate
caReply - the input stream pointing to the CA reply data, must be closed by the caller
verifyRoot - verifiy the root of imported certificate using the keystore?

Returns:

getJDKTrustedCerts

public static java.util.List<java.security.cert.X509Certificate> getJDKTrustedCerts()
Retrieve the JDK's most trusted certificates. Original idea: http://jug.org.ua/wiki/display/JavaAlmanac/Listing+the+Most-Trusted+Certificate+Authorities+%28CA%29+in+a+Key+Store

Returns:
the nonnul list of the most trusted certificates

public static java.lang.String getJDKCertFile()

the JDK's own trusted certificate keystore location.

exportCertificate

public void exportCertificate(java.lang.String alias,
                              java.io.OutputStream out,
                              boolean binary)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Exports a given certificate into an output stream. Throws KeystoreFault if the alias cannot be found or there is a problem with the keystore operations. Does not close the output stream

Parameters:
alias - the alias
out - the output stream
binary - the output should be binary (true), or text (false)?
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when writing to the output stream fails

exportPrivateKey

public void exportPrivateKey(java.lang.String alias,
                             char[] password,
                             java.io.OutputStream out,
                             boolean binary)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Export a private key entry into a choosable file format. Might throw KeystoreFault if the alias is not found or not a private key or any KeyStore exception is thrown.

Parameters:
alias - the private key alias.
password - the key password, can be null
out - the output stream to write to, cannot be null
binary - do binary (true) or textual output?
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the serialization throws IOException

serializePrivateKey

public static void serializePrivateKey(java.io.OutputStream out,
                                       boolean binary,
                                       java.security.PrivateKey key)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Serialize the given private key into a binary or textual stream format.

Parameters:
out - the output stream, cannot be null
binary - binary export?
key - the private key, cannot be null
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during serialization.

serializeCertificate

public static void serializeCertificate(java.io.OutputStream out,
                                        boolean binary,
                                        java.security.cert.Certificate cert)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        java.security.cert.CertificateEncodingException
Serializes the given certificate into the given output stream in binary or text format the output stream gets flushed but not closed.

Parameters:
out - the output stream, cannot be null.
binary - binary export?
cert - the certificate
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when the IO operation fails
java.security.cert.CertificateEncodingException - on certificate problems

Retrieve a certificate for the given private key or certificate.

Parameters:
alias - the alias
Returns:
the found X509 certificate or null if alias not found or the entry does not have any certificates

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Main program. Generates a key with a self signing certificate and shows that it is in the keystore.

Parameters:
args - the arguments - not used
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on error

importPrivateKey

public void importPrivateKey(java.lang.String alias,
                             char[] password,
                             java.io.InputStream key,
                             java.io.InputStream cert)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Import a private key from an input stream. Might throw KeystoreFault if there was an error with the keystore

Parameters:
alias - the private key alias, cannot be null
password - the optional key password
key - the input stream of the key data, cannot be null
cert - the input stream of the certificate data, cannot be null
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if error occurs when reading the input stream

Set the certificate for the given alias. Might throw KeyStoreFault.

Parameters:
alias - the alias, cannot be null
cert - the certificate, cannot be null
